text: 50cl swing top bottle. Pours slightly hazy golden colour with a huge most good lasting white head. Aroma of nice fruity hops, some citrus, tangerine. Taste of dry fruity hops, tangerine, some apricot, mild bitterness, high drinkability.
0,5l Flasche. Tiefgelbes Bier mit einer schönen Schaumkrone. Malziges Aroma nach Getreide, schmeckt nach Malz und einer guten Portion Hopfen. Ausgewogen!

Flasche 0,5l: Golden, deutliche Trübung, kräftiger stabiler mittelporiger Schaum; frische fruchtige Nase, leicht herb, Zitrusnoten, frische Hopfennoten, exotische Früchte, Malz, Getreide, leichte malzige Süße, Hefearomen; frischer fruchtiger Körper, Zitrusnoten, Malz, Getreide, Hefearomen, cremig, deutliche Kohlensäure, kräftige Hopfenaromen, angenehme fruchtige Bitterkeit, zunehmend trockener; angenehmer fruchtig-trockener Nachgang

A light fruity smell, some yeast and a little bit sweet (cookies). The white creamy head has a normal duration and size, the body is pale yellow. A light fruity taste, light bitter, the finish is long and a little bit metallic. The body is light to medium strong, very creamy with a lively carbonation.

Buegelverschlußflasche: Golden, hazy, big and stable rocky head; moderate dryish fruity to piney-hoppy nose with a grainy background; moderate to solid dry bitter flavour with a very delicate sweetness, light to medium bodied, crunchy MF; lingering dry citrussy to piney hoppy finish. California dreamin! A pretty well crafted summer sip...
50 cl bottle. In a cinema pub by chance. First California Common ever tried. Hazy gold with big white head. Floral and citrus aroma. Tangerine flavor and malt. Would like to try another C.Common .

(swing top bottle) Hazy, pale golden colour with a blond mid-sized foamy head. Fruity and piney, also slightly grassy hoppy aroma with notes of grapefruit, peaches and pears, mildly pale malty background with hints of yeasty spice. Mildly bitter-sweet flavour, light to medium bodied with a moderate carbonation. Dry and a tad slim malty base with present, mainly fruity and slightly piney hops, getting slightly grassy as well towards the bitter-sweet and dry finish. Nice and uncomplicated brew, rather suited for the summer time. 08.I.17

0,5 l bottle from a local bottle shop. Pale golden and unclear in the glass. One finger off white but fast fading head. Dry hopy grapefruity on the nose. Taste starts more floral with citrus. Sourish hints. Increasing malty in the second part. I don´t know.
Getreidiger Beginn. Milder Hopfen, spritzig, für 5,8% schwach. Süffig, mild hopfig-karamellig im Mittelteil, dann steigend hopfig. 9/8/9/8/8/8

Half litre flip top, poured into oversized Triple Karmliet tulip. A: Golden colour, very hazy, large rocky head. S: Citrus hops, hints of grapefruit and mangoes. T: Combined bittersweet tangerine with real hit of sharpness, lingering bitter finish. M: Smooth in but sharp out, low carbonation, medium body. O: Very much like an American Pale Ale, I dont know how much it resembled a traditional California Common as its a style Im unfamiliar with.
Pours a clear golden color. Aroma is grainy and grass. Taste is light grass, and fruit notes. Very light and easy drinking. OK beer.

0.5 l bottle from local Dursty, best before December 2017. Clear, golden yellow with a medium large, rather dense, stable, white head. Grassy, floral and slightly fruity aroma of fresh grass, citrus and a touch of white grapes. Fruity-grassy, floral, slightly bitter and quite dry taste of fresh grass, grapefruit, lemon peel and some white grapes, followed by a short, crisp, slightly bitter, grassy and rather dry finish. Thin to medium body, smooth and rather effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. Very refreshing and quaffable, would have been smarter to release this during the summer rather than autumn. I also still dont really know how this style should be like, all the examples Ive tried so far had only little in common. This is not that close to Anchor Steam Beer by the way.
